meanings.definition: Administering an excessive amount of medication.
meanings.sent1: The doctor warned against overmedicating the patient with unnecessary pills.
meanings.sent2: She felt unwell after overmedicating on painkillers for her headache.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the pile of overmedicating pills and meowed in protest.
meanings.sent4: The garden was wilting, overmedicating with water, drowning the plants.
meanings.sent5: The image of the overmedicating bottle overflowing stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: The act of giving too much medication.
meanings.sent1: Overmedicating can lead to serious health complications.
meanings.sent2: The nurse realized her mistake in overmedicating the patient with double the dosage.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit about overmedicating had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The overmedicating of the garden with fertilizer resulted in burnt leaves.
meanings.sent5: The news report highlighted the dangers of overmedicating in elderly care facilities.

meanings.sent1: It is important not to overmedicate children, as their bodies are sensitive.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overmedicate whenever she feels the slightest discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The robot malfunctioned, overmedicating the patient with endless doses of medicine.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to overmedicate himself led to frequent trips to the pharmacy.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overmedicating can be severe and long-lasting.
